sentence.Network_en: Traffic was unusually light for that time of day.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于一天中的那个时间段而言，来往车辆少得有些不寻常。

sentence.Network_en: He had been feeling drowsy, the effect of an unusually heavy meal.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一直感到昏昏沉沉的，这是吃了一顿超级大餐的结果。

sentence.Network_en: That's a marvellous description, Mrs Drummond. You're unusually observant.
sentence.Network_cn: 您的描述令人惊叹，德拉蒙德太太，您真是独具慧眼。

entry.def: You use unusually to emphasize that someone or something has more of a particular quality than is usual.

example.ex: He was an unusually complex man.

entry.def: You can use unusually to suggest that something is not what normally happens.

example.ex: Unusually among British prime ministers, he was not a man of natural authority.
example.tran: 他不是那种天生一副官派的人，这在英国首相中并不常见。

means.word_mean: 1. to a remarkably degree or extent;

auth_sentence.content: Yesterday was a really good day, unusually good.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yesterday was a really good day, unusually good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yesterday was a really good day, unusually good.

auth_sentence.content: This was an unusually configured and charmingly executed show.
auth_sentence.res_content: This was an unusually configured and charmingly executed show.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This was an unusually configured and charmingly executed show.

auth_sentence.content: Iannucci seems to be unusually free of such fears.
auth_sentence.res_content: Iannucci seems to be unusually free of such fears.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Iannucci seems to be unusually free of such fears.

Sentence.sentence: The result is a sort of high-quality, unusually rigorous coffee-table book, designed to be dipped into rather than read from beginning to end.
The picture worsens with each round of El Nino, the unusually warm currents in the Pacific Ocean that drive up temperatures and invariably presage (预示) droughts and fires in the rain forest
That's an unusually large drop," Plant says.

sentences.en: The company has an unusually high proportion of young people at the top.
sentences.cn: 这家公司高层中年轻人占有不寻常的高比例。

sentences.en: The old peasant conjectured that it would be an unusually cold winter.
sentences.cn: 那老汉推测冬天将会异常地寒冷。

sentences.en: The unusually heavy rainfall was an ill omen for the travellers.
sentences.cn: 异乎寻常的大雨是旅行者的不祥之兆。

sentences.en: My dog is unusually fond of chocolate.
